According to the Japanese Companies Act, a company can be classified into three types: (1) ordinary stock corporation (), (2) special stock corporation (), and (3) limited liability company (). Among these, only ordinary stock corporations are required to have an audit committee, but they do not always have a board of directors. Therefore, option A is incorrect.
